messages.message: I looked into it more by putting breakpoints and the request succeeded. I think we might be looking at a race condition but I haven't fully figured out where yet

I have a new theory we were checking if a user has permissions to update the app by running an empty deployed solution update operation. If no rows were updated, then it failed. Ignore the print statements in SSs but i think it failed since the only thing that could have been different is the updated_at time. However, if the system is fast enough, we could have the times updated in the same second so I'm guessing that would mean that no rows were updated.
Despite issues with crafting, I was able to consistently test that that was the issue and fix it. I need to write some tests and I'll have it ready tmrw
